newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-ABB makes barley payment, closes malting pool.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-ABB makes barley payment, closes malting pool.

text.p: The Australian Barley Board (ABB) said it would make a top-up payment of A$15 a tonne for all 1996/97 season barley pools and that all malting barley pools had been closed.
The A$15 payment forms part of the latest payment in a gross pool estimate which remains at A$210 a tonne for malting barley, ABB said.
Good cash flow from strong sales of both malting and feed barley had enabled ABB to make the top-up payment, which would occur across all grades in late March, it said.
ABB also said new pools would be opened immediately for all malting grades except malt three, Skiff and Chebec, which would be traded for cash.
ABB expected a gross number two pool return of A$190-A$210 a tonne, although sales from the number two pools would be into a softer market where estimated returns were uncertain, it said.
The international malting barley market was quiet, with prices having softened since the start of the selling programme, ABB chief executive officer Michael Iwaniw said.
The Barley Board markets barley grown in the states of Victoria and South Australia.
